text:
Bowery, east side, at 1st Street, showing at the N.E. corner two 2 1/2 - story old houses, Nos. 305-307 Bowery.

February 1924.

Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - 1st Street

text:
Bowery, north from but not including East 1st., Street, as seen from the East Houston Street Station of the Third Ave., Elevated. Shown in the background is the Metropolitan, New York Life and the Consolidated Gas Company Buildings. Cooper Union Institute is seen at the bend of the Elevated structure.

September 10, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - 1st Street (East)

text:
(1)

Bowery, east side, north from and including East 1st Street, to Cooper Square. The Empire State Building is shown overshadowing the Metropolitan Building.

May 9, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

The same, a different perspective of the N.E. corner. Also shown is East 1st Street, at, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of the Bowery.

October 12, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)

The same as No. 2, slightly more inclusive.

September 20, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

title: Manhattan: Bowery - 1st Street (East)

text:
(1) 303-295 Bowery, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of East 1st Street. September 20, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) 295-297 Bowery, as seen in No. 1, and showing the book store at No. 297. May 9, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Bowery - 1st Street (East)

text:

title: Manhattan: Bowery - 1st Street (East)

text:
The Bowery, east side, north from and across East 1st Street.  To the left appears the Empire State and the Metropolitan Life Insurance Bldg's. across the Third Avenue elevated lines which runs on the Bowery and continues northward on Third Avenue from Cooper Square.

July 16, 1938
Views 1, 2 and 3

P.L. Sperr
